proverbes.title: Nin wax cunay xishood. A man who has eaten something becomes shy.

metadata.title: Nin wax cunay xishood. A man who has eaten something becomes shy.

proverbes.title: Talo walaal diide taagoogta ayuu kajabaa. One refusing a sibling’s advice breaks his arm.
proverbes.content: Talo walaal diide taagoogta ayuu kajabaa. One refusing a sibling’s advice breaks his arm.

metadata.title: Talo walaal diide taagoogta ayuu kajabaa. One refusing a sibling’s advice breaks his arm.
metadata.content: Talo walaal diide taagoogta ayuu kajabaa. One refusing a sibling’s advice breaks his arm.

proverbes.title: Ngozi ya chui uzuri kwa macho, ndani adui. A leopard skin is beautiful to see, but inside there is an enemy.
proverbes.content: Ngozi ya chui uzuri kwa macho, ndani adui. A leopard skin is beautiful to see, but inside there is an enemy.

metadata.title: Ngozi ya chui uzuri kwa macho, ndani adui. A leopard skin is beautiful to see, but inside there is an enemy.
metadata.content: Ngozi ya chui uzuri kwa macho, ndani adui. A leopard skin is beautiful to see, but inside there is an enemy.

proverbes.title: Dhamiri safi ni tandiko laini. A clear conscience is a soft mat.
proverbes.content: Dhamiri safi ni tandiko laini. A clear conscience is a soft mat.

metadata.title: Dhamiri safi ni tandiko laini. A clear conscience is a soft mat.
metadata.content: Dhamiri safi ni tandiko laini. A clear conscience is a soft mat.

proverbes.title: Dua la kuku halimpati mwewe. The prayer of the fowl does not bother the hawk.
proverbes.content: Dua la kuku halimpati mwewe. The prayer of the fowl does not bother the hawk.

metadata.title: Dua la kuku halimpati mwewe. The prayer of the fowl does not bother the hawk.
metadata.content: Dua la kuku halimpati mwewe. The prayer of the fowl does not bother the hawk.

proverbes.title: Fadhila ya punda ni mateke. The gratitude of a donkey is a kick.

metadata.title: Fadhila ya punda ni mateke. The gratitude of a donkey is a kick.
metadata.content: Fadhila ya punda ni mateke. The gratitude of a donkey is a kick.

proverbes.title: Fuata nyuki ule asali. Follow bees that you may eat honey.
proverbes.content: Fuata nyuki ule asali. Follow bees that you may eat honey.

metadata.title: Fuata nyuki ule asali. Follow bees that you may eat honey.
metadata.content: Fuata nyuki ule asali. Follow bees that you may eat honey.

proverbes.title: Haraka haraka haina baraka. Hurry, hurry, has no blessings.
proverbes.content: Haraka haraka haina baraka. Hurry, hurry, has no blessings.

metadata.title: Haraka haraka haina baraka. Hurry, hurry, has no blessings.
metadata.content: Haraka haraka haina baraka. Hurry, hurry, has no blessings.

proverbes.title: Hisani haiozi. Kindness does not go bad.
proverbes.content: Hisani haiozi. Kindness does not go bad.

metadata.title: Hisani haiozi. Kindness does not go bad.
metadata.content: Hisani haiozi. Kindness does not go bad.

proverbes.title: Jogoo mtenda mema kaliwa. The rooster, always beneficial, is eaten.
proverbes.content: Jogoo mtenda mema kaliwa. The rooster, always beneficial, is eaten.

metadata.title: Jogoo mtenda mema kaliwa. The rooster, always beneficial, is eaten.
metadata.content: Jogoo mtenda mema kaliwa. The rooster, always beneficial, is eaten.

proverbes.title: Kibarua hulima juani, tajiri hulia kivulini. A day-worker cultivates in the sun, the master eats in the shade.
proverbes.content: Kibarua hulima juani, tajiri hulia kivulini. A day-worker cultivates in the sun, the master eats in the shade.

metadata.title: Kibarua hulima juani, tajiri hulia kivulini. A day-worker cultivates in the sun, the master eats in the shade.
metadata.content: Kibarua hulima juani, tajiri hulia kivulini. A day-worker cultivates in the sun, the master eats in the shade.

proverbes.title: Msinji ukiinama hauna nguvu; usiushtaki ukuta ukianguka. A foundation that is not level is not strong; don't blame the w
proverbes.content: Msinji ukiinama hauna nguvu; usiushtaki ukuta ukianguka. A foundation that is not level is not strong; don't blame the wall if it falls down.

proverbes.title: Ukijifanya asali nzi wote watakula. If you make yourself [like] honey all the flies will devour you.
proverbes.content: Ukijifanya asali nzi wote watakula. If you make yourself [like] honey all the flies will devour you.

proverbes.title: Usisafirie nyota ya mwenzio. Don't set sail using somebody else's star.

proverbes.title: Pole pole ndio mwendo. Slow, slow is the way to go.

chants.title: Baye Fall Chant unplugged
chants.content: This is a recording of Baye Fall chanting recorded in Diourbel, Senegal on July 22, 2011. The Baye Falls are a sub-sect of the Mouride Islamic Brotherhood. This was recorded outside the compound of a Peace Corps Volunteer serving in Senegal.

metadata.title: Baye Fall Chant unplugged
metadata.content: This is a recording of Baye Fall chanting recorded in Diourbel, Senegal on July 22, 2011. The Baye Falls are a sub-sect of the Mouride Islamic Brotherhood. This was recorded outside the compound of a Peace Corps Volunteer serving in Senegal.

danses.title: West African Dance at the White House, 2007Apr25.jpg
danses.content: Members from the Kankouran West African Dance Company performs during a ceremony marking Malaria Awareness Day Wednesday, April 25, 2007, in the Rose Garden, White House.
danses.authorName: White House photo by Eric Draper
